inn1.comm: Well outside off stump, left alone. Some hint of swing there.
fuller and closer to the off stump, square-driven to point. Again it swiung away. Two slips and a point.
short in length, landed outside off stump, held its line, left alone. The ball skidded off the turf.
beauty. Fullish and just outside off stump line and it shaped away nicely. Late at that. Fulton was caught at the crease, lunged forward and missed it.
full and on the middle stump line, since it has been swinging away, Fulton decides to go inside-out, with the swing, towards cover
leans forward and shoulders arms.
The tallest fast bowler in the world starts off with a length-delivery, on the off stump, pushed to cover point
lands on a length, on the middle and leg, dabbed to the on side
wide outside off stump. Rankin grimaces. Taufel extends his arms. Fulton just remarks his guard. And iam typing too much.
on the middle and leg, comes in a touch, Fulton goes back, works it to square-leg
Another wide. this time Rankin mutters to himself in disgust. As he should.
outside off stump, Fulton leans across, runs it down to third man
fullish, on the middle and leg, flicked to midwicket region
Another one. The swing starts early in the trajectory and it keeps veering away.
lands on a length, on the off stump line, shapes in, defended on the front foot
back of length, on the middle and leg line, dabbed to the on side
length-delivery on the pads, tucked away for a single.
length-delivery on the middle and leg, shaping in and thuds into the pad
leans forward and defends. Head over the ball and all that jazz.
stifled appeal for lbw. Struck outside the off stump line. Full in length, landed outside off and came in a touch, Fulton leant forward, got his front foot across and tried to defend.
fuller, on the middle stump line, sliding in, Fulton keeps his left foot across, stops the movement of that foot and wrists it across the line through midwicket.
Again driven through the midwicket region. Half-volley on the leg and middle, flicked away in style.
full in length, outside off stump, half-steered, half-edged to third man
lands on a length, outside off stump, goes on straight and left alone
More tripe from Rankin. Down the leg side this time. Wonder what's ailing him. The zip seems to be missing.
low swinging in full-toss, driven to mid-on
Another four. Fullish and on the middle and leg, Fulton leans forward and drives it past a diving mid-on
short of length, slanting away from the off stump, Fleming leans forward and thumps it past point.
tip and run. Leans forward, taps a length-delivery close on the off stump and runs. 'keeper runs across, the ball has by now gone back of the stumps and he tries to kick it to the stumps.
Shot. Overpitched on the middle stump line, down came the bat, met the ball flush in the middle and he just punched it away. Like a boxer. There was no great follow through.
half-volley outside off stump, off-driven past mid-off. The wheels are coming off for Ireland. Half-volleys, over-pitched deliveries and fullish balls on the legs. C'mon guys tighten up!
better. Just outside off stump, full in length, left alone
yorker-length, on the middle, jabbed away to the on side
Rankin continues to be way ward. Another one down the leg side. Hmm....
It doesn't get better. It does for Fleming though. He chases a wide full-toss outside off and slashes it to wide third man region
full and straight, driven to mid-on
Suddenly, against the run of play, Fleming falls. Full and wide, it was there to be hit but Fleming sliced it straight to point.
gets off the mark with a fluent off drive. Past mid-off.
lands on a length, outside off stump, comes in a touch, Marshall is caught at the crease, neither forward, neither backward, bunts it away to the on side
lands on a length, just outside off stump, Marshall pushes it out to cover.
full and outside off stump, Marshall leans forward, square-drives, the bottom-hand comes off the handle, the top hand gives it direction and he squeezes it past point

Both are looking pretty good out there. Fulton and Marshall. This time its Marshall who leans forward and drives between extra cover and mid-off. Again too full in length. Not much movement and it begs to be driven. He has to shorten the length slightly
better. Short of driveable length, outside off and left alone
Spot on again. Back of length, lands outside off stump, goes on straight, the bat comes down in an angle and the ball threads the bat and pad gap and flies past the off stump.
full, on the middle stump line, the bat comes down a trifle late and in an angle, gets an outside edge to point.
on the middle stump line, on a length, Fulton gets behind the line, drives to mid-on
slowish off cutter. Comes in from outside off and Fulton is beaten on the forward prod. It thuds int to the front pad.
on the off and middle, defended to the front foot
half-volley on the legs and you know where that went. To the square-leg boundary. Nicely picked up. Leant forward a touch and wristed it over square-leg
homing in on the off stump, defended on the front foot
Short of length, outside off stump, chopped to third man
pushed to cover point for a single
full, slightly slow in pace, on the off stump line, driven to short extra cover fielder.
full again, almost at the block hole, on the middle and leg, dug out to mid-on
run down to third man for a single
well outside the off stump, Marshall chases after it and misses.
on the middle stump line, driven towards mid-on for a single
again well outside off stump, Fulton doesn't flirt. At least on the field, so far. Leaves it alone and a wide is called.
outside off stump, Fulton leans forward, defends, edges it to third man
full in length, driven to mid-off
full in length, on the middle and off stump, driven back to the bowler
leans forward and defends. The bat face shut a touch and the ball bobs to the on side.
length-delivery outside off stump, Marshall eases it to cover.
beaten on the drive. It was full and outside off and Marshall was sucked into a loose drive. The bat went inside the line.
full and well outside off stump, Marshall chased after it and slashed it over point.
homing in on the middle and off stump line, driven to short cover. The left leg was dangerously kept across, a little bit more and he could have been a lbw victim.
on the off stump line, square-driven to point.

Morgan takes a beauty. At cover. It was full and outside off, Marshall tries to drive it over cover, mistimes and the ball bobs over Morgan. He backpedals, stretches his hands above his hand and holds on to it. The bowler is ecstatic. He does a little jig.
Smooth. Full-pitched outside off, Styris glided forward and caressed it straight down the ground.
sliding down the pads, tickled behind square-leg
length-delivery on the off stump line, defended on the off side
length-delivery outside off stump, square-driven to point
lands on a length around off stump, pushed to cover

grubber. shooter or whatever you call the one that keeps pretty low. Short in length and it scooted through, Fulton shaped to pull but it was a submarine. Thankfully, for him, it was outside off and he survives.
defended to the leg side, full length ball and angling into his pads, moves his front foot forward and taps it cautiously
full on off, Styris pushes his front foot well forward and drives crisply, straight to mid-off
slow ball this time, floated into off, Styris defends it solidly to the off side

streaky streaky. Wide outside off and Stryris goes for the fierce slash, ball takes a thick edge and flies dangerously close to the diving wicketkeeper. Races past his outstretched right hand for a four
pushed to mid-on, seems to be gathering himself after the previous misjudgement
wide again, goes for the slash again, bounces a tad high and Styris, goin for the slash again, misses
good length outside off, angling in, shoulders arms
cracking drive, drifting onto his pads and Fulton eases into the drive, creaming it past midwicket for a boundary
patted back patiently down the ground, good length ball and on off and middle this time
good length again, outside off, defended it to the off side
wide of the stumps, Fulton lets it go
full and outside off again, Fulton extends his front foot and pushes it to the off side, short extra cover mops up
good length, outside off, front foot plonked out, thumped straight to mid-off. Styris on the move, just can't find the gaps
outside off this time, pushed wide of cover and steal a quick single
slow offcutter this time, goes for the drive but misses
tapped to the off side, confident attempt but straight to the fielder
the accurate stuff continues, Fulton angles his bat and steers it to the off but it's straight to point.
well wide and moving away, Styris would have struggled to reach that with a pole vault.
full outside off, drawing the batsman forward, Styris is too early on his drive and a thick inside edge goes straight to mid-on
slightly short, back of a length, doesn't rise that much but Fulton rocks back and pulls it away. He's a tall man and it's too short for him.
defended to the off side, front foot tap
fullish, outside off stump, driven square to point
full-pitched on the off stump line, driven to mid-on
overpitched outside off and Fulton creams it through cover point. He leant forward and drove it square.
back of length - that's the length to bowl on this track- and Fulton is beaten pushing at it.
another half-volley on the legs, driven through midwicket region.
another over-pitched stuff. driven to cover

Styris falls. Done in by the change of pace. Scrambled seam and it floated outside off stump. Styris is bit early into his drive and nicks it behind. Smith does his jig again. Rolls his fist over each other and takes them behind and does a chicken act. At least, that's what it appears to me. Got to ask him in the PC.
hits the deck short of length, lands outside off stump, comes in a touch, McMillan jabs it in front of him
slides on the middle and leg, McMillan leans forward, pushes it to wide mid-on for a single.
full in length, outside off stump, defended to cover
length-delivery outside off stump, driven on the up to point. He went too square, could have had some value for the shot had he went more in the V.
full in length, driven to short cover
leans forward and drives through the cover region. This time he makes an effort to  go in the V and not go square.
again full-pitched, driven to left of mid-off. Ireland continue to pitch it up full.
full and outside off, left alone
beaten. In the temptation zone outside off and Fulton drives inside the line.

ugly swipe across the line. Try telling that to Fulton. He picks up three runs. It was full in length and outside off stump, Fulton leans forward and swung it across the line. Gets a thin inside-edge as the bat face shuts and it speed to the fine leg region
leans forward, drives a length-delivery back to the bowler
full-pitched, outside off, McMillan drives, too much bottom-hand and the ball rolls to mid-off
swing and a miss. Full and outside off, McMillan tries to thrash it through cover, again too much bottom-hand and the bat goes inside the line.
on the middle and leg stump line, bunted through square-leg
short in length, outside off, cut down to thrid man
lands on a length, outside off stump, McMillan pushes it to cover region. Doesn't move his feet much, just jabs it away.
gets closer to the line of a similar delivery and drives on the up to cover
nice probing delivery: back of length, cuts in from outside off, McMillan stabs at it, gets a inside-edge on to the front pad. Stifled appeal from the bowler.
the offspinner starts off with a flighted delivery outside off, pushed back to the bowler
flighted delivery outside off, driven to extra cover
driven to left of midwicket and a diving stop there.
slower through the air and very well flighted. Above the eye-level. It dipped and Fulton leant forward, turned it past square-leg
lands on the off stump, goes on straight, pushed back to the bowler.
paddled from outside off stump, to short fine leg region.
the salesman goes dancing down the track and it's maximum. He backed to the leg side in the process nad flat-batted a short of length delivery over long-off.
cut and a miss. Short and well outside off, McMillan tries to upper cut it over backward point but can't reach it
short of length, just outside off, punched to point
slashed away. There was a backward point and a squarish point. McMillan pierced the gap. Bit of width outside off and he sliced it on the up, through that gap.
gets a single with a push to extra cover region
length-delivery on the middle, worked to midwicket
full in length, around off stump, Fulton leans forward, pushes it to right of mid-off
floated on the off stump line, Fulton gets his 6th ODI fifty,  by wristing it past square-leg.
on the off stump line, swept to long leg
turns in from outside off, slow in the air, Fulton tries to work it to on side but is beaten by the lack of pace and it thuds into the pad. Outside off stump.
flatter, outside off stump, pushed back to the bowler
tossed-up - he is unafraid to give it air, on the off stump line, turned to midwicket
full in length, turned to midwicket
leans forward, drives to long on
floated outside off stump, McMillan leans across, places it smartly past square-leg and comes back for the second run
outside off stump, driven to cover
low full-toss, outside off stump, driven to long-off
straighter one. outside off stump, McMillan pushes at it, goes inside the line and edges it to short third man
on the off and middle stump line, driven to left of mid-on
nicely flighted, outside off stump, swept past square-leg

The salesman sells himself short. Mac gets Mac. Brain explosion. McMillan backed away from the stumps and tried to force a full-length delivery through the off side. No luck. Gets a outside edge and it goes straight to short third man. NZ wobbling here.
slip in place now. Floated from round the stumps, defended on the front foot.
on the off stump line, worked past midwicket
short in length, on the middle and leg, Oram goes back, wrists it to fine-leg.
on the middle stump line, he tries to paddle it away, doesn't connect well.
on the middle and leg, turned past midwicket
on the off and middle, defended on the front foot
again pushes forward, is struck on the pad, O'Brien appeals but it was turning away, past the sticks.

run out chance missed. driven to right of wide midwicket, Oram sets off from the non-strikers end. He thought that was going to long on. Porterfield charged across, dived, stopped and under-armed a throw but it misses the stumps. Had it hit, Oram would have been a goner.
outside off stump, bit of flight, Fulton is beaten trying to sweep it.
leans forward to defend
leans forward and on drives to long on

aha! reverse sweep attempted, he misses but fools the 'keeper in the process.It was outside off stump, Oram doesn't connect and O'Brien moves away to the leg side in anticipation that Fulton would connect. He had overestimated Oram!. And they pick up some byes.
defended on the front foot
turned behind square-leg for a single
flatter, on the leg and middle, worked to midwicket
tossed-up, on the off and middle, swept in front of square.
well flighted delivery, outside off stump, it dips, driven to long off
floats on the middle and leg, Oram tickles it past midwicket for a single.
on the off and middle, hit uppishly towards midwicket.

loud appeal for a catch behind. That was flat, quick, sliding down the leg side, Fulton tries to flick, misses and it must have brushed the pad. Good take from O'Brien. Bucknor remains impassive as ever.
When in doubt ,sweep. swept past square-leg for a single
sliding down leg side, paddled away fine. Very fine.
slightly short in length, turns in from outside off, Fulton goes back, cuts past point
on the off stump line, swept away
leans forward, drives to long off
slow through the air, on the off stump line, nudged to the off side
fuller, on the middle and leg, Oram took his front leg from the line, brings his bat down,. drives through the on side.
tossed-up, really slow in the air, making Oram make his own pace, he leans forward, waits, drives to long-on
floated outside off, Fulton square-drives it through point. No sweeper cover and they will get three runs
on the middle stump line, turns a touch, Oram tries to work it to onside, gets a leading edge down the track/. Very well bowled.
flatter, slides down the leg side, brushes the pad and O'Brien gathers. Thinks about appealing but has one look at the schoolmasterly look of Bucknor and just keeps quiet.
leans forward, drives to cover
tossed up, on the middle and off, wristed to deep midwicket for a single.
flattish and on the middle and off stump, reverse-swept past point. This shot has become quite popular these days.
on the middle, driven to long-on.
on the middle stump line, dabbed to midwicket
full and outside off, driven to long off
on the off stump line Fulton picks up another single with a flick through midwick
worked away to the leg side, on the back foot and easily turned to short midwicket for a single
around the wicket to the left hander, drifting on the pads and tucked away to the leg side for a single
tried for a quicker one but gets the direction wrong, way down leg and the batsmen complete a couple
full and spinning from off, Fulton goes for the sweep but doesn't make contact, wicketkeeper juggles with it
down the ground for a single, steady shot that time
quicker ball and straight, defended solidly back to the bowler
swept to square for a single
full toss, turned away to deep midwicket
down the ground to mid-on for an easy single
tapped away behind square for a single, they're milking the bowling now
driven back to the bowler, front foot out but can't get the timing
full and quicker, swept away behind square
patted away to the leg side.
turned away to short midwicket, the batsmen don't want to take any risks here. McCallan keeping it tight
driven back to the bowler, cautiously done
full and outside off, driven straight of mid-on. Fielder dives full length but can't cut it off

Crack from Fulton, flighted outside off and he picks up the length early, goes down on the ground and sweeps it behind square for a crisp four. It's the first four in 13 overs. Is this the time to step it up?
driven to long-on for a single. Time for drinks

good ball to start off with, back of a length and raps Oram on the pads, appeal goes up but that probably hit him outside off. The real drama starts after that. Fulton is too far down the ground and Oram declines the single, cover picks it up but can't nail the direct hit. Had that hit, Fulton was gone for all money
back of a length and slightly short again, patted away to the leg side
turned away in front of square for a single
fullish length, tapped to mid-on. Some rain in the air. It's getting gloomy out there

yorker length, Fulton digs it out, gets a deflection to the off side and takes off for a quick single. Third man swoops down and tries another direct hit but misses again. New Zealand taking some risky runs here but Ireland need to hit the stumps if something is to happen
firm square drive but that's a brilliant dive at backward point to cut off the four
on the off and middle, driven to long-on
another single to long-on
on the middle and off, driven down the ground.
lands on the off stump line, comes in with the arm, defended on the front foot
on the off and middle, swept to long leg.
flighed, on the off and middle, driven straight to extra cover
loud shout for lbw. Taufel shouts out No. It landed outside leg stump. End of the story. Moved in and struck him in front of the stumps.
length-delivery around off and middle, patted to the off side
slightly slower, full in length, on the middle and off, Oram drives to cover.
lands on a length, outside leg stump, moves in, Oram stands tall, punches it to midwicket
fuller, almost yorker length, on the middle stump line, Oram whips it down the ground, to long on
slower one, fullish, turned towards mid-on
Goddim! Full, flat, on the middle and off stump line, Fulton goes for a sweep. The bat meets air, the ball meets pad and it would have gone to hit middle.
on the off and middle, defended down the track
spins in from outside off, dabbed to the on side
tossed-up, slow through the air, pushed to point
on the middle and leg, turned behind square-leg, Oram comes rushing across, is sent back and he makes it in time
leans forward to defend.
on the middle and leg, tickled around the corner for a single.
full and on the leg and middle, flicked straight to midwicket
full and outside off, driven to long off
overpitched outside off, McCullum drives to long-off.
full in length, on the middle and leg, Oram presses forward, drives to right of mid-on
another full-pitched delivery, another single down to long-off.
lands outside off, turns in slightly, pushed to cover for a single
goes on a bent knee, sweeps it to deep backward square-leg
slightly short, on the off stump line, McCullum backs away to cut it past point

Another one goes down! Ireland are having a fab day out there. Oram charges down, White fires it in on the middle stump line and Oram can't get under it, ends up drilling it straight to long-on. More naughty leprechaun jigs..
on the middle stump line, driven down the ground
full in length, on the off stump line, jabbed to point
beaten. Full, outside off stump, Vettori tries to cut it but doesn't connect.
on the hips, tucked behind square-leg for a single
full and well outside off stump, left alone
length-delivery on the middle stump line, dabbed behind square-leg. Impeccable placement and more importantly, he played it with soft hands. Will come back for two.
beaten. It pitched on a length, around off stump and held its line. McCullum  has a lame poke at it and is beaten by the straightening of the delivery.
floated on the off stump line, Vettori cuts it late. Ala Ranatunga. Very nice to watch.
fuller, outside off stump, McCullum leans forward, opens the bat-face, guides it to short third man region

huge appeal for a catch down leg side. Bucknor is impassive. They shout louder and slowly the fatal finger comes up. It was sliding down the leg side, Vettori attempts to sweep, he must have gloved it. Very good take from O'Brien who moved smartly to his right. New Zealand in trouble. Seven down. Irish fans must be chuffed.
on the off stump line, pushed to cover.
straigher one. Beaten. Landed outside off stump and went on with the arm, Franklin tries to cut but is missed.
On the middle and leg stump line, McCullum moves in line, whips it off the hips, past square-leg. By the time the deep backward square-leg fielder and deep midwicket chap converge, he picks up two.
full and on the middle, driven to mid-on and he runs with the stroke.
length-delivery, bounces a touch, around off stump, Franklin leans forward, opens the bat-face, steers it to third man
fuller and down the leg side. Rankin has had his problems with the wide in this game. With the new ball it was swinging way outside off, now he is threading down leg.
outside off, on a length, McCullum eases forward, pushes it past cover. Misfield there and he capitalises. One more run.

overpitched on the off and middle, cracked down the track and it crahses into the sticks at the other end. Rankin tried to get his boot to it, doesn't. Lucky for Franklin who was outside the crease and had no time to get back. It rebounds off the stumps and they take a single
single with a flick past square-leg
full and on the middle and off, Franklin drives inside-out to right of cover. Gets McCullum on to the strike.
faster, driven to deep point. 200 up. Not in style though. They have lost 7 wickets.
slower through the air, on the off stump line, Franklin waits, chops it to gully region
low full-toss, driven past the bowler. Not much power behind that.

on the off stump line, guided to short third man. Franklin had set off like a mad bull, McCullum screams at him to get back and he does it in time. If it was a direct hit, it might have got interesting
will retain the strike with a drive to sweeper cover
short in length, on the middle and leg, again McCullum places it well, past square-leg and picks up two runs
fuller, straighter, almost yorker-length, on the middle stump line, driven down the ground
full in length, outside off stump, turned to the wide third man region
full in length, around off stump, McCullum leans forward, places it to left of cover.
lands on a length, on the middle and off, pushed to cover.
overpitched outside off, driven in the V, down to long-off.
tossed-up, on the middle and off, Franklin drives, uppishly with a bit of a leading edge, over the bowler
takes two steps down the track and drives to long-on. Will McCullum go for the slog sweep?
Nope. He takes a single with a swat-drive to long-on
Franklin attemps to charge down, fired in on the pads, and he can't get bat to ball. It runs off the pad, towards short third man region
quicker and slightly short in length, cut to cover.

streaky edge through the vacant slip region. It was flat and around the off stump line. McCullum pushed at it, with an open-face of the bat, playing for the spin but the ball didn't turn in much, collided with the outside edge and ran past the gloves of the 'keeper and through the slip.
attempted yorker turns into a low full-toss, on the middle, McCullum shuffles across, flicks it to deep midwicket
And guess where this one goes. Past that man. Another yorker that went slightly awry. Low dipping full-toss on the legs, flicked fine.
Two in a row. There was a drought for 12 overs and now we have two in sucession. Overpitched on the middle and off stump line, drilled straight down the ground.
length-delivery outside off, hit on the up to left of sweeper cover and they run hard to come back for  two.
full-pitched, driven back at the bowler who makes an half-stop
The third one in this over. Short in length and McCullum swivels off the front foot to pull it behind square-leg. Didn't connect well, it went high in the air, but the placement was fine.
full-pitched on the off stump line, Franklin takes out the front leg from the line and powers it down to long-off
slightly short of yorker-length, on the middle and leg, lapped behind square-leg
full in length, outside off stump, driven to cover
short of driveable length, outside off stump, McCullum goes for a slog across the line but was beaten by the change in pace. Inside-edges it past the stumps.
Runs are coming in a flood. Full and on the leg and middle line, swung to deep backward square-leg region.
up... up and over long-on. Right in the slot, on the middle and leg, Franklin took out the front leg out of the line and hit it cleanly. Boom.

full and outside off, McCullum sliced it to left of sweeper cover. He runs the first run hard, turns for the second and beats the throw. Peter Gillespie was the fielder. They refer it to third umpire. Not out is the verdict.
Another four. McCullum is making merry. Full-pitched, on the stumps and he went inside-out over extra cover.

Whack. Huge hit. A glass is broken in one of the airconditioned boxes in the pavilion. Full-pitched and he went down town. Crash. The glass cracked from side to side. McCullum is clubbing everything here.
But he is gone now. Done in by the change of pace. He goes for the cow corner, the ball balloons towards deep midwicket and he is caught.
Driven to widish long-off and they rush across for two runs. Had it been a direct hit, Bond would have been a goner.
Full in length, slanting away from Franklin who slashes it to third man region.

inn2.comm: Full in length, on the off and middle, pushed towards mid-off and they steal a single.
length-delivery, lands on the off stump line, came in with the angle, jabbed on to the pad.

Almost three ducks in a row for Bray. He pushed to left of Oram at point and rushed across. He stumbled midway, recovered and scrambled across. The throw came in flat and fast and he just about makes it in time. It was refered upstairs and not out was the verdict. That was close.
beaten. In the zone outside off stump line, he pushes inside the line.
slightly short in length, outside off stump, and it keeps a touch low. Porterfield pushes at it, gets a bottom edge on to the ground and it rolls to McCullum
Bond starts with a wide down the leg side. McCullum dives to make a half-stop.
rushes through the channel outside off stump, left alone.
fuller, on the middle and leg stump line, pushed with a straight face of the bat. Two slips in place.
hits the deck short of length, around middle and leg, slants away, guided to backward point
Here comes the bouncer. Bray drops his wrists and sways away.
fuller, on the middle and offline, Bray pushes at it, bat and pad together. McCulum appeals as he thinks it hit the pad first. It did.

Bond strikes. Lethal delivery. It pitched on a length, on the middle and off, shaped away off the seam and Bray has to play at it. He does. Pushes at it, inside the line and the ball kisses the outside edge and rushes to McCullum.
beaten. Landed outside off stump, on a length, came in a touch and again it keeps a touch low. Porterfield pushes outside the line.
leans forward, guides a length-delivery, on the off stump line, to point
lands on a length, comes in on the middle line, clipped past midwicket.
It flies through the vacant gully region. Short in length and outside off,  Morgan flashes it down to third man
No swing for Franklin, so he is trying to move it off the seam. This one homed in on the off stump, defended on the front foot.
full, straight, down the leg side. It brushed the pad enroute to McCullum
on the pads, tucked behind square-leg for a single
yorker-length, on the off stump line, edged, along the ground, to third man
on the middle stump line, defended down the track.
short in length, lands outside leg stump, moves in, pushed to point.
slanted across, left alone
length-delivery, on the off and middle line, defended on the front foot. Head over the ball. Left elbow high.
full and on the off and middle stump line, shapes away a touch, Porterfield thrusts his right leg across, tries to work it across the line, gets a outside edge, to third man
beaten. Landed on a length, outside off stump, came in and he pokes at it.
teasing stuff. This one holds its line after landing in the zone outside off, Morgan is up to the task, leaves it all alone
slower one, low dipping full-toss, pushed to the off side.

beaten again. Franklin has troubled the batsmen whenever he has landed the ball on a length and brought it in a touch. Not enough to damage the off stump. The batsmen seemed surprised by the angling in, and they have a hurried stab at it.
short in length, around off stump, steered to point
full and straight, driven to mid-off
drifting on to the pad, flicked to fine -leg
pitched on a length, on the middle and off, moves away, defended down the track
full-pitched on the middle and off stump line, turned to the on side
slower one, on the middle stump, he picked it late but adjusted and worked it behind square-leg
slips down the leg side. Another wide.
137.3 kmph, length-delivery, angling across and steered to backward point
from round the stumps arrives a delivery down the leg side.
comes down the track, Oram drags back the length, and aims at the body, worked to the on side
in the channel outside off , left alone
angling in from round the stumps, clipped past square-leg
homing in on the off and middle, defended to the off side
full in length, just outside the off stump, comes in a tad, defended with the bat and pad close together. Almost like a Test match.
short in length, around off and middle, tapped to the off side.

Bond picks up his second wicket. Banged in short, it kicks up chest-high, Porterfield goes for a pull, but it was going away from him and climbed more than he expected. The top-edge takes the ball high over slips, Styris turns back from the slip, runs back to take it.
Bond greets him with a bouncer. Swayed away nicely.
full, straight, on the middle stump line, nudged to the on side
Gets off the mark with a leg glance. Sliding on the hips, tucked to fine leg.
rushes through the channel outside off, left alone
Oram is sticking to round the stumps attack. Length-delivery, on the off and middle stump line, defended on the front foot
leans forward, pats a length-delivery to cover
posthumous swing! It was banged in short, climbs over the batsman and then it swings. McCullum moves to his right to gather. Posthumous swing cos the swing starts after it leaves the batsman.
homing in on the off and middle, defended carefully to the off side.
fuller, on the middle stump line, flicked to square-leg
on the off and middle stump line, steered to point
beaten. Teases the outside edge. It was a length-delivery that slanted away.
yorker-length, on the middle, turned to square-leg
back of length, lands outside leg stump, slants towards middle, nibbled to the on side
Classy. Full-pitched on the middle and leg, O'Brien, the best Irish batsman on view, leans forward and caresses it through the midwicket region.
yorker, on the leg and middle, O'Brien takes care not to get his front leg across, wrists it down to fine leg. Very compact batsman.
on the leg and middle, attempts to whip it across, gets a inside-edge on to the pad
just short of driveable length, outside off stump, pushed to mid-off.
on a length, around off stump, not much room to work with, steered to point
bouncer. Always dangerous . be in discotheque or on a cricket field. Morgan starts to duck but it doesn't bounce as much as he expected and then sways away quickly
leans forward, left elbow high, pushes a fullish delivery to cover
full and on the off stump line, leans forward to defend. Tuk - Tuk cricket continues.
on the middle, full in length, driven to mid-on
slower, fuller, on the middle stump line, picks it and brings down his bat defensively
whizzing past the off stump. That was close. Morgan lets it go throguh. It was pretty close to the off peg and McCullum lets him know that with some oohs and aahs..
full-pitched on the off stump line, driven to mid-off.
O'Brien breaks free with a fierce pull. Short of length, coming in towards off and middle and he cracked it past square-leg. Eye-catching stroke.
They are trying to show some urgency here. Morgan charges down the track but Oram adjust and a hurls in a back of length nagging delivery on the middle, pushed to backward point
stays back, opens the bat-face, runs it down to third man
full, straight, on the middle, defended down the track.
on the off stump line, defended back to the bowler
Oram prises out Morgan. Probing line outside off stump, slightly short in length, Morgan shapes to cut but nicks it behind. Three down now and struggling.
length-delivery outside off, goes for a cut, under edge takes it to on side.
full and on the off and middle stump line, turned to square-leg
full on the off, driven to cover. Ireland losing wickets with the asking-rate climbing. Not the best of times
full and wide outside off, front foot well forward and drives well but straight to the fielder
full outside off again, front foot again, driven again, straight to mid-on this time
defended down the ground
back of a length, defended down the wicket
whipped away to the leg side for a single. Kevin gets off the mark
full ball outside off, Niall angles his bat and steers it down to third man
slow, loopy short ball, Kevin waits and waits and waits before pulling it in front of square for a couple
crashed cover drive, full and wide outside off and Kevin crunches it superbly through the covers for a four. It's the first four in a while.
defended down the ground
Niall down the track and whips it behind square for a quick two. It seems as if the 'O Brian brothers have decided that it's time to step it up.

drops it in front of him and thinks of a quick single, takes a few steps down but is sent back. Oram rushes in and kicks it onto his stumps but Niall makes it back. Imagine two brothers involved in a run-out! Now that would be such a waste of all those backyard matches
slower ball and Niall, who charges down the track and tries to whip it away, misses it. Luckily for him, it misses the stumps
slightly short and tucked away for a single. Fine leg was vacant but he can only get is square
heavy ball, gets it to zip through after pitching, not much bounce and Kevin is beaten with the ball whizzing past his prodding bat
slightly wide and he goes for the cut, too close to his body and misses again. Any thoughts of giving his in-form brother the strike? Family squibble, eh? Hopefull a drinks break settles all
lands on a length, outside off stump, guided to point
banged in short, Niall has a lame poke at it and is beaten
charges out but can't get under the delivery and ends up nudging it to the off side
dabbed to right of backward point and they rush across for a quick single
slightly short in length, on the off and middle, Kevin shapes to pull, under edges it to square-leg
low full-toss, on the middle, pushed to mid-on
Kevin walks down the track, has a swing across the line but no contact.
backs away, slashes a length-delivery to third man
walks across, tries to pat a slower one to the leg side, misses and it runs off the pad. There is a lbw shout but the impact was outside off.
on the middle and leg, on a length, lapped behind square-leg
low full-toss, Kevin tries to thrash it, makes contact with the bottom-half of the bat and it rolls over to cover
full and outside off, crashed through cover. He cashed in on the width there.
slightly short, cut past point
flighted delivery, outside off, whipped with the turn to widish long on
turn and bounce. Landed on the middle, spit past the outside edge.
When in doubt sweep. Niall tries it but is beaten in the flight and it thuds into his chest.
If the traditional technique fails, opt for the unorthodox. Niall leans forward and reverse-sweeps it past the slip fielder. Nice strike.
around the off stump line, he stays beside the line, steers to backward point

Stunning effort from McCullum. Franklin, from round the stumps, hurled one full in length and just outside off stump, Kevin tries to whip it across the line,  gets a inside-edge, McCullum dives to his left. The ball brushed the ground before nestling into the web of the glove. The umpires confer with each other and rule it not out.
leans forward to defend
Kevin charges out, backs away in the process, swats a length-delivery to cover
That's landed somewhere in the cuckoo's nest. A lofted on-drive. He leant forward and creamed a full-pitched delivery over long-on. Stunning.
shout for lbw but there was an inside-edge. On the off stump line, Niall pushes at it, nicks to his pad
Another arm-ball, on the off stump line, full in length, cut to backward point
Niall unfurls another reverse sweep. Seems to be the flavour of this WC. Bunted through backward point.
floated in on the off and middle stump line, goes on straight with the arm, another inside-edge on to the pad
tossed-up, slow through the air, defended on the front foot
slides in on the legs, runs off the pad
tossed outside off, Kevin sweeps it to long leg
outside off stump, tries to turn it to leg, leading-edge takes it through backward point
quickish arm-ball, beats the forward prod and thuds into the front pad. Loud shout but it was going down leg side. Taufel shakes his head.
another one that goes straight on, on the middle and off, played towards point
beaten. Outside off stump and Niall pushes at it inside the line. Again beaten by the lack of spin
on the off and middle stump line, driven down the ground for couple of runs. Partnership 42 in 56 balls.
Picks up a single with a drive down the ground
on the middle and leg, Niall attempts to sweep it but doesn't make contact
slightly short in length, on middle and off, again not much turn, squirted towards point
floated on the off stump line, defended on the front foot
floated on the off stump line, deflected to right of midwicket
arm-ball that rushes on towards the off stump, jabbed away
slower through the air - he is mixing 'em up, nudged to the on side
floated on the off and middle, driven to mid-on
from really wide of the crease, arrives a floater on the middle and leg, driven inside-out to long-off
quicker, outside off stump, defended on the front foot
Huge hit.. What a way to bring up the fifty partnership. Down he came the track and heaved a delivery outside off, over long-on. It soared into the stands.
flighted delivery on the middle stump line, Niall leans forward, waits for the spin, drives inside-out to cover
lands on the same spot and it goes on with the arm. Niall plays for the spin and the ball evades the waft and hits him on the pad. It was going down leg side though.
retains the strike with a sweep to long leg
slow in the air, lands outside off stump, comes in a touch, Niall goes back, waits, works it to on side
Another reverse sweep. But straight to short fine-leg fielder
goes back, waits for the turn - its slow in nature and whips it behind square-leg
quickish, on the middle and leg, driven to deep midwicket
flattish, on the middle and leg, flicked away behind square-leg

oh lovely. From wide of the crease, he sent it slow through the air. It looped around middle and off, Kevin was on the front foot, was made to wait but he adjusted and whipped it past midwicket. Good cricket all round.
length-delivery on the off and middle, pushed to the off side
off cutter, outside off stump, steered to point
short in length, on the off stump line, Niall shuffles across, wrists it to midwicket
short in length, on the off stump line, Kevin backed away a touch and hit it on the up, chipped it through mid-off region to left of long-off
leans forward, pushes to extra cover. Marshall swooped in and under-armed a throw which hit Kevin while he was trying to ground his bat inside the crease
Kevin is clubbing it. In style. Full swing of the bat, makes contact flush in the middle and up she flies over long-on.
outside off stump, Niall tries to sweep, misses, and it strikes the pad
gets off the strike with a clip shot through square-leg
slow in the air, on the middle and leg stump line, Kevin had premeditated a paddle shot but is made to wait and then he helps it behind square-leg
flatter, faster, on the legs, tucked to right of short fine-leg
quickish, lands outside off stump, turns a touch, cut past point
tossed up, on the middle and off stump line, Niall sweeps, gets a top edge and it bobs over the 'keeper's head
short of a length and Kevin slaps it to cover and takes off quickly, thinks of two but settles for one
patted to extra cover. Some urgency from the batsmen here. It's high time too
cut to cover, straight to the fielder

oh that's quite a mess. Two brothers involved in a run-out. If this had happened in the backyard ... Niall pushes to the off side and thinks of a single, Kevin responds and is too far down the track as Marshall swoops down to return the ball to Styris, the bowler. The bails are off and Kevin is well short. If mama 'O brien is watching, she wouldn't really be too impressed. Nial sold Kevin the dummy there
defended down the ground
driven to mid-off but well stopped there
tried to cut, beaten. Quicker ball from Vettori this time
fired in down the leg side, batsman sweeps but it's too far away. Three wides that time. Good bit of fielding at the fine-leg boundary by Peter Fulton
turned away behind square for a single, on the back foot

thick edge to short third man, Oram flings himself to his left and pulls off a fine stop, throws it to the non-striker immediately and that was nearly another misunderstanding. Both batsmen thankfully make it back
goes for the sweep but it's too full for that. McCullum collects the ball and whips the bails off in a flash. Niall, also a wicketkeeper, gets his backfoot back in time
reverse paddle attempted, can't get the timing, ball pops up on the off side
on the middle stump line, turned to midwicket
short in length, on the middle and leg, clipped past square-leg and they run hard to come back for the second run
fuller, on the middle and leg, flicked to long leg
Niall comes down the track and heaves a fullish delivery to widish long on
backs away, length-delivery on the off stump line, hit on the up, past cover
well outside off stump, fullish, driven back to the bowler
drifts in on the middle stump, turned to midwicket
really slow in the air, on the middle stump line, turns a touch, patted to the off side
fuller, faster, on the middle, driven to midwicket
makes it hang in the air a bit, outside off stump, Trent is made to wait and he punches it to point region
leans across, turns a full delivery outside off to short fine-leg
on the middle stump line, worked past midwicket
comes down the track and biffs a fullish delivery to widish long-on

Niall is gone. He can go in and explain to his brother about that run out. Tossed-up, on the middle stump line and Niall tried to slog-sweep it across the line, doesn't get under it and sends it straight to deep midwicket
on the middle and off, driven to long on
spins in from outside off, tries to turn it on side, misses and it hits him on the pad outside the off stump
floated outside off, swept to Styris at square-leg
on the middle stump line, sliding in, Trent chips it towards long-on
on the middle and off, turns a touch, defended on the front foot

trapped in front. Drifted in the air, from round the stumps, landed on the middle stump and slided in. White goes for a sweep shot, misses and is struck in front of middle and leg. It would have hit the leg. Taufel agrees. Up goes the index  finger and White has to make the long walk back to the pavilion.
on the off and middle, flatish, pushed to cover point.
on the off stump line, cut to point
wide of the crease, lands outside off stump on a length and spins away. Trent tries to sweep it on the length but is beaten.
outside off stump, turns in slightly, swept behind square-leg
flighted up, Trent waltzes down the track and drills it through mid-off. Misfielded and he will get a boundary

Done in by the pace. Patel fires that one in, lands outside off stump, turns in and Johnston is surprised by the pace. The bat comes down late and in an angle at that and he is caught in front. It would have taken out leg stump.
full, worked to midwicket
spins from outside off, defended on the front foot

huge shout for lbw. not given by Taufel. That's close. Drifts in from round the stumps, goes on with the arm to strike him in front of off stump. It was crashing into the furniture. Taufel must have thought it must have hit him outside off stump
on the middle, worked to the on side
on the off stump line, driven to cover

Taufel agrees this time. Drifts in the air, lands on the middle stump line and straightens. Gillespie thrusts his left leg across and gets in a tangle as a result. He is unable to bring the bat around his front pad and is struck in front of the middle. Plumb.
quicker, fuller, on the leg and middle stump line, turned away past square-leg
turned to square-leg, McCallan backs up a touch too much but gets back in time
lands on the off and middle, spins down the leg side, tries to sweep and it runs off the pad
quickish, outside off stump, beaten trying to run it down to third man
flighted, on the off and middle, defended on the front foot
spins in from outside off, nudged to short third man
arm-ball, goes on straight after landing outside off stump,  jabbed away to the off side
on the off stump line, nudged to the on side

castled. McCallan goes down the track and yorks himself as Vettori pushed that one through quick. The ball goes under the bat and he must have heard the death rattle. Although it appeared that he didn't hear it as he was trying to get back into the crease. He saw the damage and walked back to the pavilion

The bearded Vettori comes up with a yorker to wrap up a big win. Full, quick and on the middle and off stump line. It beat the hurried waft and rammed into the front boot. It would have pegged back the middle stump. NZ win by 129 runs.

Ricky has a query: "will Vettori be on a Hat-trick for the next NZ match, since he did not get to bowl a 3rd ball to get it in this match?"
                         Nope. It doesn't carry on to the next game. 

This is Sriram Veera signing off. Coming up tomorrow:  South Africa v West Indies. Hopefully, it will be a cracker of a contest.  Join us then.
